main event: Two oblong, gold objects were spotted in the sky over Santa Maria, California on June 24, 1955.
interesting points: The objects appeared to be the size of a half-dollar at arm's length.
The sighting lasted for thirty-five (35) minutes.
The report includes photographs of the objects.
The objects were initially unidentified, but were later identified as a balloon.
The sighting was a combination of ground-radar and air-visual observation.
